Docs.summary: Represents the base class for views that define the appearance of data in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode is derived from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase> class. You typically use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> control to lay out data in columns. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase> class to create custom view modes for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView.View%2A> property defines the view mode that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> control uses.
